            PROJ. II

abstracts.cdata!:
The Ghazi-Barotha Hydropower Project is
            a major run-of-the-river environmentally sustainable power
            project, designed to meet the acute shortage of power in
            Pakistan. This environmental assessment presents the main
            results of studies of the potential effects of the project
            on the natural and human resources of the northern Indus
            river plain. This study discusses environmental impacts on:
            1) land resources, 2) water resources; 3) biological
            resources; and 4) social and cultural resources. The study
            also offers a mitigation plan complemented by a detailed
            resettlement action plan, and a monitoring plan which is
            designed to ensure the effectiveness of the mitigation
            program. Institutional needs and community participation are
            two other important areas discussed in this study.
